dca — Direct Coupling Analysis operations¶

This module provides direct coupling analysis operations.

See also

Direct-coupling analysis of residue co-evolution captures native contacts across many protein families

F Morcos, A Pagnani, B Lunt, A Bertolino, DS Marks, C Sander, R Zecchina, JN Onuchic, T Hwa, M Weigt (2011), Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. 108:E1293-1301.

Module Syntax¶

Empty.

Module Contents¶

dca.dca(inputfile, outputfile)¶

Direct Coupling Analysis (DCA)

Parameters:
  • inputfile (file) – file with fasta formatted sequences
  • outputfile (file) – file containing N(N-1)/2 rows and 4 columns

Structure of outputfile:

  • residue i (column 1)
  • residue j (column 2)
  • MI(i,j) (Mutual Information between i and j)
  • DI(i,j) (Direct Information between i and j)
dca.get_similarity(ref, query, theta)¶

Does not check the length of both objects.

Parameters:
  • ref (obj) – iterable object which will be compared with query
  • query (obj) – iterable object which will be compared with ref
  • theta (float) – reweight sequences with identity threshold
Returns:

0 if greater than theta, 1 if less than theta.
